Name: CochraneCoreOntology
Title: Cochrane Core Ontology
Description: The Cochrane Core ontology describes the entities and concepts that exist in the domain of evidence based healthcare.

Name: CochranePICOOntology
Title: Cochrane PICO Ontology
Description: The PICO ontology describes questions in evidence based healthcare with the intention of supporting the publishing of evidence as linked data.

Name: EvidenceCertaintyRating
Title: Evidence Certainty Rating
Description: The assessment of quality, confidence, or certainty.

Name: SynthesisType
Title: SynthesisType
Description: Types of combining results from a body of evidence (eg. summary data meta-analysis).

Name: CEOsysCodeSystem
Title: CEOsys Code System
Description: Codes for clinical guideline recommendation representation missing from other code systems.

Name: RecommendationStrengthCS
Title: Recommendation Strength
Description: Strength of a clinical guideline recommendation.

Name: ActionCombinationMethodCS
Title: Action Combination Method
Description: Code system for the combination of actions in a PlanDefinition.

Name: EvidenceToDecisionCertaintyRating
Title: Evidence To Decision Certainty Rating
Description: GRADE Evidence to Decision (EtD) Framework Certainty Ratings

Name: EvidenceToDecisionCertaintyType
Title: Evidence To Decision Certainty type
Description: GRADE Evidence to Decision (EtD) Framework Certainty Type

Name: GuidelineStageClassification
Title: Guideline Stage Classification
Description: As part of the project planning for the creation or updating of a guideline,     a decision should be made at an early stage about the planned level classification ("S classification") according to the AWMF's system of rules (1-3).     The S-classification scheme of the AWMF differentiates between the classes S1 treatment recommendation as well as S2e, S2k and S3 guideline.     The "S" stands for the extent of the applied systematic approach in the development process of a guideline.     Each class thus stands for a specific methodological concept that must be presented in a way that is comprehensible to the users.     The choice of class is based on the question of how much effort is appropriate and feasible.     The need for legitimacy for the implementation of the guideline (convincing the target group) must be taken into account.     When choosing a higher S-classification in the context of updating a guideline, the adaptation to the corresponding methodology has to be considered.
